definition: to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
interesting/to interest
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease

sentences.english: That must have been highly diverting , said he. I see.
sentences.chinese: “那一定挺逗趣兒的，”他說，“我明白了。”

sentences.english: Bertha found it possible to look back upon the past with something like amusement.
sentences.chinese: 伯莎發現可以象逗趣一般地回憶某些往事。

sentences.english: Forcing her to be on her toes, teasing her, is exciting and attractive.
sentences.chinese: 使她窘困，逗趣他，那是很讓她興奮和吸引她的。

sentences.english: Jack enjoys bantering with his friends.
sentences.chinese: 傑克喜歡和他的朋友們說笑逗趣。

sentences.english: Please release those pleasant peasant teaser who brings us plenty of pleacertain.
sentences.chinese: 請釋放那個帶給咱們巨大愉快的友好的農民逗趣者。

sentences.english: You can laugh at someone without being amused.
sentences.chinese: 即使沒有逗趣的事情人也能大笑。

sentences.english: Bean teddy bear. The funny expression was well drawn and made me laugh.
sentences.chinese: 那逗趣搞怪的表情畫得很好，看得我都忍不住笑了。

sentences.english: The sky on their books funny word mother has strong repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 雲天的媽媽對言路逗趣的話產生了強烈地反響。

sentences.english: It’s so modern and so amusing.
sentences.chinese: 小說非常現代，非常逗趣。

definition: to do sth wacky/wacky/wacky behavior
humorous/jocular/zany
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
(loanword) humor/humorous
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
entertaining/hilarious
endearingly silly
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
charm/humor/wit/humorous/witty
endlessly interesting (idiom)/very witty
